page.title: 06LOCAL COUNCILLOR
page.content: Malcolm Waugh, local regional councillor for Hamilton North, is Chairman of COSLA and was born and brought up in{Blantyre.} In his time, he has seen a small mining community change into a thriving town with a new shopping centre, sports complex and a population rise from 9,000 to 29,000. {Bothwell,}a residential area, has no industry and people are quite willing to travel to Blantyre for shopping and leisure activities. For the future Mr Waugh hopes to create employment for 800 people within 3 years by bringing one of Europe's largest computer companies to the industrial estate in Blantyre. At the east side of Blantyre, there lies derelict land and the plan is to construct a centre for youth in the area.
